info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 5 at 11:35PM CDT until September 6 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Fort Worth TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of north central Texas, including the following county, Dallas.
* WHEN...Until 200 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms that moved across Dallas County. Radar estimates between 1 and 2 inches of rain have quickly fallen in the past hour. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding on roads, low lying and/or poor drainage areas in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dallas, Garland, Irving, Grand Prairie, Mesquite, Carrollton, Richardson, Lewisville, Flower Mound, Rowlett, Desoto, Grapevine, Cedar Hill, Wylie, Coppell, Duncanville, Lancaster, Farmers Branch, Balch Springs and University Park.
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM CDT SATURDAY
